page.title: 08Agriculture in the Claydons
page.content: The pattern of agriculture has changed over the years in the area around Steeple Claydon.Once it was a{labour {-intensive}industry but modern methods have changed it all.In 1881 Claydon Estate employed 30 men,today just 2! Once the area grew{food for {London,}the farms were mixed but now changes have been brought about by economics and the Common Market. Dairying is on the decline and the area has largely gone over to{arable {farming and sheep. {Wheat and barley}are the main cereals grown while the yellow flowers of{oil {seed rape}dominate large swathes of the landscape. {Hay and silage}are grown for animal feed and the harvesting of these is an example of where{mechanisation}has replaced many workers.
